dialogues.text: (quietly) I’m not just talking about the demo. Steve? If it tanks we don’t swallow cyanide, we go back to the drawing board.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No more drawing boards. You invent the Edsel twice and you don’t get anymore drawing boards. So let’s not--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Tell me what the plan is. You have to tell me the plan because I don’t know. You're walking around like you've got can’t-lose cards.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The plan will reveal itself to you when you're ready to see it.  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 85.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Will I have to drop acid?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Couldn’t hurt.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Is there a plan?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Have I ever let you down?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Every single goddamn time.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Then I’m due.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Is there?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Joanna, there is a plan. But I don’t want to put you in a position where you’re lying to people. JOANNA considers this a moment...

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: (pause) Start 15 minutes late so Avie (can recompile and try to give us a fighting) --

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, how many times--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: --are we gonna have this con--we’re not starting late. Ever. We’re not ever starting late.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: But where do you come down on starting late? STEVE takes a moment...  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 86.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Lisa’s been doing this thing where she asks me about stuff I’ve already told her. She asks me questions and I know she already knows the answers. What’s that about?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Kids do that when they’re scared one of their parents is in a bad mood. They try to get you talking about something you like. It’s very common and can be treated by talking to her about things she likes.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) Do have any training or experience in this field?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Tell ‘em to open the house. STEVE heads down the hall a little, opens the door and wa into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --where CHRISANN is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Where's Lisa?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: She’s around.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: She's running around the building.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: An hour ago you said you were taking her to school.  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 87.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: She begged me to let her stay. There are fathers who would so love--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It is wrong, okay? It is morally wrong, it is parentally wrong, it is wrong for you to use Lisa as a way of getting money from me. She will know if she doesn’t already that that is your primary use for her and (she will hate you for it for the rest of your life).

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: (over) She will see, if she doesn’t already, that her mother is a woman who stands up to men.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: By living off of them.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: By not letting myself be imprisoned and degraded by them.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Imprisoned? I can’t get rid of you!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: I need a doctor and I need a dentist.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I dropped out of college after a semester but okay, let’s have a look.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: You will support your daughter and her mother.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Did you pay someone fifteen hundred dollars to bless your house?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I said?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Did you?  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 88.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: I don’t remember how much it was, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It was fifteen hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: They don’t do it for free.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: They don’t, they charge fifteen- hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: How I spend--fuck, you know, I’m (not even gonna--)

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (over) Were you about to say, “How I spend my money is none of your business?”

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: I have a sinus infection and I need to see a dentist too.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: So you can see how your blessing budget could have been better spent.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: Like on a perfect cube?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Look at me, Chrisann.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Look at me. You know who I am, right?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: And you know I know people.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 89.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Look at me. And you know the people I know, they know people.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: If I ever hear again that you've thrown a cereal bowl at Lisa’s head--

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: --my private line is gonna ring and a voice on the other end is gonna say, “We're all set.” And that’s how I‘’11 learn that you're dead.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: Are you cra--I threw the bowl on the floor! I didn’t throw it at her head, she wasn’t even in the room! She was nowhere near--I threw it on the floor!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: She's a little girl, you're scaring her. I’m a grown man, you’re scaring me. Taking out the garbage is a chore, clearing the table is a chore, waking you up in the morning is just fuckin’ creepy.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: Please teach me more about being a parent. It means--—

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We’re done here, Chris.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: It means so much coming from someone who won’t admit he is one.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We're all set. Stop screaming at Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: I give her responsibilities--  39 40 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: --and one day she’s going to thank me for it.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Probably in your sleep.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: I never threw anything at her head. I never--I never would. (broken) Things don’t become so because you say so.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: There’1l be more money in your account by the end of business. STEVE opens the door and walks out into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --where JOANNA’s still waiting.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Are you being nice?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Andy’s next.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hertzfeld or Cunningham?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Hertzfeld. He’s playing with Avie Tevanian and the computer backstage. JOEL PFORZHEIMER, the reporter we met briefly in act, runs and catches up with STEVE and JOANNA. 90. the first 39 40  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 91.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Steve?! STEVE turns to see him coming but keeps walking with JOAN

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Can he do it later, Joel, we go in 8 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Can I just get a quick reaction to the press this morning?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: The size of it, the volume.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I’1l1 tell you on background--

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: I was hoping for a quote from Steve.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I’11 tell you on background that I’ve never seen anything like it in the tech industry. I called the Wall Street Journal to take out a full page ad for today and you know what their sales guy said? “Why bother? It'd be like notifying Macy’s that tomorrow is Christmas.”

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: You saw the Stewart Alsop newsletter?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Joanna, I need to get Steve on the record.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: The headline was “Dear NeXT: When Can I Get My Machine?”

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: When can he?  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 92.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: We’1l announce the ship date in the next 8-10 weeks.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Alsop’s not talking about the ship date, he wants to know when he can get one to play with.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: We have a lot of respect for Stewart Alsop and we want to get a machine into his hands so he can tell his subscribers about it.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: And when will that be?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Very soon.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: A couple of days, a week? Off the record.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Off the record?

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Completely.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: We think--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He'll get it when it’s finished. JOEL stops walking. STEVE and JOANNA stop too.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (pause) It’s not finished?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It’s almost finished.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: I’ve been watching you rehearse the demo for three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yes.  40 4l STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 93. 40

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: What’s left?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: A little thing.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I think that’s enough.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We're off the record and Joel’s always been good at understanding nuance.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: What’s left to finish?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I guess in layman's terms you'd have to say we don’t have an OS.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (pause) An operating system.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Well the OS is what runs the computer. In fact it sort of is the computer.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: How has it been running, how is it gonna run this morning? What do you Mean you don’t have an OS? They walk into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDY HERTZFELD is huddled over the shoulder of AVIE TEVAN and some ENGINEERS who are busy with last minute checks.  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 94.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Avie Tevanian is our chief software designer and he wrote a demo program. It’s like this, we built a great car, we haven't built the engine, so we put a golf cart battery in there to make it go for a little bit. All this computer knows how to do right now is demonstrate itself.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (quietly) You're telling me the only thing you've built is a black cube?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) Yes. (beat) Yeah, but isn’t it the coolest black cube you’ve ever seen?

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Is this--we’re off the record--is this a strategy or a problem because if it’s a problem-- STEVE interrupts this and points to ANDY--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Do not share proprietary knowledge with that man.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: (confidentially to JOEL) It’s not a problem. STEVE’s walking over to ANDY and AVIE, who are busy on th computer.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I wouldn't understand it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I don’t understand it either and my name’s on the patents.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It’s got email.  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 95.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Email’s not just for tech specialists anymore. Well it is, but it won’t be.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: And I assume an email sent on a NeXT computer can only be received by a NeXT computer?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Closed end to end. (to AVIE) The new trash can is wrong. I want to tell you I appreciate all the hours you put into it but I can’t because of how terrible it is.

dialogues.speaker: AVIE
dialogues.text: We'll go back to the other one.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: And why are we still giving three options on the clock?

dialogues.speaker: AVIE
dialogues.text: How many options do you want to give?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Two. Buy it or don’t.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (to STEVE) Can I talk to you a second?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Absofruitly. ANDY leads STEVE away to talk to him privately--

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Look, man, Avie’s been recompiling but he says there may be some glitches this morning.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: If all there are are some glitches it’‘ll be a triumph of a miraculous magnitude. Why are you translating for Avie?  4l STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I didn’t want him to find out the hard way your position on glitches in a demo but it sounds like you’ve mellowed.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I've been growing, Andy, I’ve been learning to love myself.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t have ever dreamed that was a problem.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Fantastic burn. You need to go to your seat.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: And how ‘bout Lisa? Getting into a school for gifted kids?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, she was tested and it turns out she can fly. ANDY wants STEVE to treat this like it’s a big deal.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Seriously, it’s a big deal.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I know it’s a big deal. That’s why I built the school a building.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I’m sure that’s not why she got in.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Can I show you something funny from MacWorld?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I can’t think of anything I have to do right now.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It‘ll make you feel good. (calling) Joanna, look at this. 96. 4l  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JOANNA comes over--ANDY’s taken a folded-up page from a magazine out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Andy, he’s only got a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It’s Guy Kawasaki writing in MacWorld, you’re gonna like this.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Can we all enjoy it later?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: He wrote a parody press release about Apple buying NexT for your OS. He imagines a near-future where Apple needs your OS and has to buy NeXT and you come back as CEO. He has Gates saying there would now be more innovations from Jobs that Microsoft could copy. You can read it later.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (taking the article) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: She would have gotten in without you donating a building. (beat) She's a very bright girl, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (beat) Still, it was something to talk about in the interview.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Alright, good luck. ANDY exits backstage to head out into the house...

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Give it to me, I’1l throw it out for you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna hang on to it. STEVE folds the article and puts it in his pocket. JOANNA stares at him, trying to puzzle through what’s happening.  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 98.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? (beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: You ready for Sculley?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Mm-hm. But STEVE’s seen something up in the lighting grid. She’s sitting in her coat and scarf and listening to music on h Walkman.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. (calling) Lisa?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: You can’t shout. STEVE heads up the metal stairs and onto--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA sees her father and smiles as he walks toward her.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You have to go. She either can’t hear him or is pretending she can’t.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s dangerous up here, that’s why I make other people do it. LISA points to her headphones. STEVE kneels down and push the headphones down around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who are you hiding from, me or your mom?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I’m not hiding.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Let's go. LISA gets up and follows her father to the stairs--  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 99.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What were you listening to?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I’m listening to two versions of the same song. And then when I get to the end I rewind and listen to them again. It’s the same song but the versions are different. STEVE holds a moment...then sees an opening.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) What’s the song?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Okay, so it’s a really old song and it’s called “Both Sides Now.”

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: “Both Sides Now.”

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Yeah. That went alright so STEVE tries it again.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (beat) What’s it about?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (thinks) It’s about--there are three verses. Clouds, love and life. And the person singing is singing that they used to think of, that they used to think about, you know--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: --clouds, love and life.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: --right, one way, yeah, but now they look at them another way and now they’re, you know, they've...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (beat) --they’ve come to the conclusion that they really don’t know clouds, love or life at all?  42 43 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Those are the exact words.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah Joni Mitchell, ‘cause it’s not a really old song unless I’ma really old guy. You have to go to school now. They've come down the metal stairs and land--

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You want me to tell you the difference between the two versions?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Right now.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: The first version is the kind of thing you’d call girlish.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean that I want to know the difference right now, I meant you have to go to school right now.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I can stay and watch.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You are truant, you’re committing a crime.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna miss anything important.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I read ahead. The Pilgrims make it to the New World. JOANNA opens the door and steps into the backstage the corridor-- 100. 42 43 area from  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 101.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Steve?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Then the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (paying attention to JOANNA now instead) Yeah you skipped over a couple of centuries.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Chrisann’s out here. STEVE and LISA are quiet for a moment...we HEAR the sound the giant sold-out house.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Can I make my case for staying?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No. STEVE walks LISA out into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --where CHRISANN is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: She was with me.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: Come on. Your dad doesn’t want us to stay.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hey that’s not true, that’s not-- STEVE gives CHRISANN a look that says “What the hell?”--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to LISA) You have to be in school is all.  44 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 102.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (to CHRISANN) I’m committing a crime right now, I don’t want to get in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You're not in trouble, I was kidding.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (nodding) Okay. STEVE’s feeling the pull of not really wanting her to go.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) Hey what was the second version? You said the first version was girlish, what was the second version?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (pause--thinks) I can’t really think of the word.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (beat) Okay, well have a good day at (school).

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (over “school” ) Regretful.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Like wishing you could go back and do things over again.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) You’re too young to be regretful.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Not me, the person singing the song.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (beat--nods ) Got it. Regretful. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: A45
dialogues.text: 45 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 103.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) That makes sense because of-- She puts her arms around her father’s waist and hugs him-

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Good luck. CHRISANN and LISA head off as STEVE stands there with JOA looking on. STEVE turns and looks at JOANNA and she looks a spot on the floor and shakes her head. STEVE’s thinking about a lot of things but all that comes of his mouth is--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Clouds.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: (pause) Six minutes. You want to see Sculley?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: That wasn’t a question.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It sounded exactly like a question to me. I'll see him after. Steve walks down the corridor alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve surveys the crowd for a moment then walks out into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Steve stops when he hears the voice of John Sculley

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: You know all those times I told you you needed security? Here’s why. STEVE’s looking at SCULLEY. SCULLEY’s a sworn enemy now b STEVE’s not going to show him that. He has bigger plans.  45 46 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 104.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) I don’t know how it is I’ve gotten older and you haven’t. Some deal with the devil I was never offered.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: So you know what I’ve been thinking for the last four years?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: As it turns out I’ve never known what you were thinking.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: No newborn baby has control, do you know what I’m talking about? In ‘84, before the Mac launch, you said--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: You said that being adopted meant you didn’t have control.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) We're starting in a minute so--

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Why do people think I fired you?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It’s fine, John, it’s all behind us.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. STEVE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 46 It’s a beautiful house but it’s almost entirely unfurnish There’s a very nice floor lamp, a framed photograph of Einstein on the wall...and that’s about it. Except for a that sits in the middle of the floor. The DOORBELL RINGS--STEVE looks at the door--

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 105.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Don’t play stupid, you can’t pull it off.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You came here to ask me--

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUT TO
dialogues.text: 48 STEVE’S FOYER - NIGHT 48 STEVE opens the door and SCULLEY is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Sorry to come by unannounced.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: --why people think you fired me?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I haven't seen or spoken to you in three years.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Why do people think I fired you?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) Just confirm something for me, okay? You liked the ad, right? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 106.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The commercial. “1984.” You liked it?

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUT TO
dialogues.text: 50 INT. STEVE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 50

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: When are you gonna get furniture?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It’s not an easy process.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: It is, you buy a couch and take it from there.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I’ve been thinking a lot about couches. What do we use them for?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Steve-—

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I'd be really surprised if you came here to talk about interior decorating.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I liked the ad very much.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: You know I did, now please answer my question.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You're lying, son of a bitch, you tried to kill it.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUT TO
dialogues.text: STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 107. 52 INT. STEVE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 52

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: It’s time to take a hard look at the Mac.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It’s past time. It’s overpriced, we need to drop it to nineteen ninety- five. We need to double the marketing budget, put more bodies on an internal hard drive and invest in FileServer.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Where would that money come from?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It would come from finally getting rid of the Apple II.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Where the hell did you get the idea I tried (to kill the ad?)

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Lee Clow.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Lee's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He’s lying?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: He’s mistaken.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You agreed with the board.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I understood the board’s concerns but I certainly did not (try to kill--)

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The board’s concern that we didn’t show the product.  53 54 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 108.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Among other things, but my (question was--)

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (over) What other things? You said among other things.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. STEVE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 54

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: The Apple II is the only thing making money.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: That's because we keep selling it.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: (pause--this is awkward and hard) I can’t diagram that logic but--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We keep making it so people keep-- the Mac needs to sell for $1995.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: There is no market research telling us the Mac is failing because it’s overpriced. It’s telling us that people don’t like it because they think it doesn’t DO anything, it’s closed end to end. We didn’t know it wasn’t what people wanted but it isn’t, they want slots, they want choices, they want options. The way we buy stereos, mix and match components.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: John, listen to me. Whoever said the customer is always right was, I promise you, a customer.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: My job is to make a recommendation to the board.  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 109.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Recommend that we drop the price, double the marketing--

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Well what are you gonna do, recommend that we kill the Mac?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I already have, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) What?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Among other things, it was set ina dystopian galaxy, it took place on a planet where we don’t live, it was dark and the opposite of our brand. And we didn’t show the product. People talked about the ad but most of them didn’t know what we were selling.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUT TO
dialogues.text: 56 INT. STEVE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 56

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Just now. An hour ago. I’m coming from Markkula’s house.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: And what did he say? (beat) What did he say?  56 57 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 110. 56

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: What do you want the headache for? Moving money around, figuring out what--invent something new. I’‘1l give you a team, you can sit in Maui, the resorts come with couches.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (beat) Wait a minute--are you saying you recommended terminating the Mac or you recommended taking me off the Mac team?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: (pause) Figure out what’s next.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You thought it was dark?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: (beat) They thought it was--it had skinheads in it but that’s (not the point).

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (over) She was liberating them.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Liberating the skinheads.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The ad didn't have anything to do with fucking skinheads! We used them as fucking extras! Nobody even knows they were skinheads!

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I’m saying the board--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You invented lifestyle advertising and “our brand” was my brand.  57 58 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 111.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: We showed a lot of happy people drinking Pepsi, we didn’t say the world was gonna come to an end if you bought a Dr. Pepper. And we showed the product! We showed it being opened, we showed it being poured, being consumed--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You think the secret to your success was not assuming people knew what they were supposed to do with a can of soda?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I didn't kill the ad, Steve! I'm the only reason it made it on the air!

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. STEVE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 58

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: If we drop the price and (double the budget) --

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Steve! You can’t drop the price and double a budget! The only way to do that is to take money out of the Apple II and--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The Apple II should embarrass you. It embarrasses me. If you had any pride at all--

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t embarrass the shareholders, Steve, (the share) --

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (over) I don’t give a shit about--the shareholders are your problem, that’s why I hired you, so I don’t ever have to hear about--  58 59 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 112. 58

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: The shareholders are my problem and the board represents the shareholders. That’s how it works.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (figuring it out) You're doing both. You're moving me off the Mac and phasing it out.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Woz and I offered to put up our own money and you’re the only reason the ad was on the air?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: How do you figure?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: We'd bought three spots in the Super Bowl--two 30’s and a 60--for six-hundred thousand and after we screened it the board wanted that money back and they asked me to sell off the spots. Chiat/Day sold off the two 30’s but not the 60 and I let it be known to Lee Clow that if he didn’t try very hard to sell the last spot I wouldn’t be unhappy. And that’s how the ad got on the air. Maybe remember that the next time someone tells you you were brilliant to only run the ad once.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUT TO
dialogues.text: STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 113. 60 INT. STEVE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 60

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You're really talking about killing the Mac.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I’m euthanizing the Mac, it’s a mercy killing.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna take this to the board myself.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Don’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I am doing that.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: You can’t.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You sure it wasn’t Lee Clow who dragged his feet selling the 60?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: At my direction, Steve, you think he would have done that on his own?! Taken it on himself?!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yes, I think he would have done what it took to save it from you!

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I was the only thing protecting it!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You didn't want the ad because you were trying to kill the Mac two months before it launched!

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: You are fucking delusional!  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 114.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And now it’s like two boxers unclench after a furious ser of punches, move apart and take a breath...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Can I mention something to you? I have no earthly idea why you're here.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: The story...of why and how you left Apple...which is quickly becoming mythologized...isn’t true.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUT TO
dialogues.text: 62 INT. STEVE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 62

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I’m going to the board.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Don’t press it with the board, Steve. I’m imploring you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: They believe you’re no longer necessary to this company. We stay with STEVE being silent for a long moment before

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I’m not your publicist.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I get hate mail. Death threats.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: And I’m not your employee.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I get death threats. My kids get taunted. Why do people think I fired you?  STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 115. 63

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) Joanna’s gonna call my name ina second.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Steve?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: That was unrehearsed. (calling out) Yeah, I'll be just a second.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I gave you your day in court.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You gave me--

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I gave the board a clear choice. I said do you want to invest in the Apple II or the Mac and they chose the Apple II--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The same people who wanted to dump the Super Bowl spot--

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: (rides over STEVE) --and then I got on a plane to China.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN BEATS AGAINST THE WINDOW as we see SCULLEY sitting a the bar. A CONCIERGE steps up--

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: Mr. Sculley?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Or I almost got on but I got a call in the lounge.  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 116.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Who made that call?

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It matters to me. Who made the call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCULLEY is on the phone at the desk, listening to the voi at the other end.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If you get on that plane you’1ll have lost your job by the time you land. He's starting a civil war.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I left my bags on the plane--my shit’s still somewhere in Beijing-- I took a car back to Cupertino in the middle of the fucking--

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUT TO
dialogues.text: 68 INT. SCULLEY’S OFFICE - NIGHT 68 RAIN BEATS AGAINST THE OFFICE WINDOWS as SCULLEY speaks o the phone--

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: I know what time it is, I needa quorum here in one hour. And I want Steve here too.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: 69 70 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 117.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You took me off the Mac and it was bad business. The quorum call was a homicide.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Right there is the part that’s bullshit, my friend, it was a suicide, because you knew your cards and I showed you mine, I showed you mine and you did it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHRISANN’S KITCHEN - NIGHT 70 CHRISANN is arguing with STEVE while six-year-old LISA ha her face buried in her homework at the kitchen table. Rai beating against the windows.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: Everything’s about her all of a sudden. All the time. All she does is come home and do homework and study and ask to see you. Everything's about her. Everything's about you. And I’m the maid.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I don’t think you’re the maid and I guarantee you’re the only parent in America who's complaining about her kid spending too much time studying. The DOORBELL RINGS--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who comes over to your house this late? CHRISANN exits the kitchen to get the door. STEVE looks a LISA...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quietly--confidentially) It’s almost 10. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 118.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you finish with that you should get ready for bed, okay?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Can I live with you? What? STEVE’s stunned by the question that was heartbreakingly sincere and simple and came out of nowher He’s about to say something--anything--when CHRISANN come back in with ANDY HERTZFELD.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I tried your house first. Sculley’s called an emergency meeting of the board. STEVE’s still thinking about what LISA just asked--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Sculley’s getting the board together.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Right now.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He’s supposed to be on his way to China. ANDY shakes his head “no”--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Somebody told him. (to CHRISANN) I have to go to--she should get ready for bed when she’s done with this.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISANN
dialogues.text: Good tip.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (to LISA) I’m sorry. Lees?...I have to go.  70 71 72 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: STEVE and ANDY head out as we--

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: What’d you think I was gonna do? I’m okay losing but I’m not gonna forfeit.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I’m not okay losing. 119. 70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 Rain is beating against the windows. BOARD MEMBERS are th in various different dress--some from an evening out. STE stands to the side while SCULLEY addresses the board --

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: We're losing market share and the Mac is losing money. Our only hope is the Apple II which is stagnating because of it’s soon-to-be-obsolete DOS. Users are already rigging their machines to run with the CP/M operating system that’s been built to run on Intel. I can’t put it more simply than this--we need to put our resources into updating the Apple II.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: By taking resources from the Mac.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: It's failing, that’s a fact.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: It’s overpriced.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: There is no evidence--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I'm the evidence! I am the world's leading expert on the Mac, John, what's your resume?!  72 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: You're issuing contradictory instructions, you're insubordinate, you make people miserable, our top engineers are fleeing to Sun, Dell, HP--Wall Street doesn’t know who’s driving the bus, we’ve lost hundreds of millions in value and I’m the CEO of Apple, Steve, that's my resume!

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: But before that you sold carbonated sugar water, right? I sat ina fuckin’ garage with Wozniak and invented the future because artists lead and hacks ask for a show of hands. The board is tense...even a little bit scared...except SCULLEY, who just takes a breath, takes a beat and says--

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: (pause) Alright, well...this guy’s outta control. I’m perfectly willing to hand in my resignation tonight. But if you want me to stay you can’t have Steve. He’ll have to sever any connection to Apple. Settle him out. He can keep a share of stock so he gets our newsletter. (pause) I’m dead serious, I'd like the secretary to call for a vote. The BOARD MEMBERS look at STEVE, who leans against the wall..

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause--then evenly to the board ) I fucking dare you.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 121.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: You've done an outstanding job over the years of cultivating the press and by that I mean manipulating it ‘cause none of them, and none of their editors, and none of the editors’ publishers, to this day, have any idea that you forced it. That you forced the board even after I told you exactly what they'd do. Which is exactly what they did. Unanimously.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I don’t have any trouble remembering that, John, because of it being the worst night of my life and I forced a vote because I believed I was right, I still believe I’m right...and I’m right. I bled that night and I don’t bleed. But time’s done its thing and I really haven’t thought about it in a while. I absolutely understand why you’re upset and I want people to know the truth too. SCULLEY looks at STEVE...he’s lying.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s time.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (calling to JOANNA) Got it.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: (pause) You’re gonna end me, aren’t you. STEVE smiles...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (smiles--almost laughs) You're being ridiculous. I’m gonna sit center court and watch you do it yourself. Then I’m gonna order a nice meal with a ‘55 Margaux and sign some autographs.  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 122.

dialogues.speaker: SCULLEY
dialogues.text: Jesus (Christ).

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (over) You want my help, Pepsi Generation? Don’t send Woz out to slap me around in the press. Anybody else. You, Markkula, Arthur Rock, anyone but Rainman. Don’t manipulate him like that. Whatever you may think I’m always gonna protect him.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: That’s what men do. I can’t start late. STEVE exits out into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --where JOANNA’s waiting. They walk down the corridor in silence for a few moments before--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I don’t think there was any way to detect a chip on my shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Did you know back at Bandley, the Mac team gave an award every year to the person who could stand up to you?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I won three years in a row.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Cool. They walk through a door and are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --where JOANNA pushes STEVE up against the closest wall.  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 123.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What the hell-- JOANNA reaches into his pocket and pulls out the folded MacWorld article.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: This--Guy Kawasaki in MacWorld--he accidentally got it right, didn’t he? You’ve been dragging your feet on the NeXT OS until you can figure out what Apple’s gonna need. Again we can HEAR the rock concert energy of the audience waiting for Steve...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Even if that were true it doesn’t sound diabolical to me. STEVE nods to the STAGE MANAGER--

dialogues.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
dialogues.text: (into headset) House to half. We HEAR the audience CHEER. We also HEAR a synthesizer introduction to a piece of mus that will crash in in just a moment--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I’m your closest confidant, your best friend, your thing--what do you call it--work wife. This whole time, the last three years--

dialogues.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
dialogues.text: (into headset) House out. Stand-by VO 1.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: --when did you change your mind and start building the Steve Jobs Revenge Machine?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) You remember Skylab? It was an unmanned satellite NASA sent up in the early ‘70s on an eight year data gathering mission. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 124.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The thing is, when they sent it up they didn’t know yet how they were gonna get it back but they felt like they were close enough that in the eight years it was gonna be up there they'd figure it out. They didn’t. So after eight years it lost its orbit and came crashing down in a thousand-mile swath across the Indian Ocean. Little to the left, little to the right and somebody coulda gotten hurt. (beat) I really wanted to build a computer for colleges. The technology just didn’t catch up as fast as I needed it to. And you know we’re outta money. But then Apple stopped innovating and I saw something better. Joanna, I know schools aren’t gonna buy a $13,000 dictionary with good speakers, you know I know that. But Apple will ‘cause Avie Tevanian is gonna build exactly the OS they need. And they’re gonna have to buy me too. For half a billion dollars in stock and end-to-end control on every product. STEVE gives a nod to the STAGE MANAGER--

dialogues.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
dialogues.text: Go vo l. A WOMAN with a script open on a music stand speaks into a microphone--

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (into mic) Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome--

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: --and the synthesizer intro becomes “For Unto Us a Child Born,” the beautiful choral piece from Handel's “Messiah, only it’s a contemporary version being sung semi-acappell The Roches. With “For Unto Us a Child is Born” as the score we go thr a series of scenes.  76 77 78 79 80 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15

dialogues.speaker: PETER JENNINGS
dialogues.text: More than a year after it was first unveiled to industry insiders, the NeXT Computer is now available in retail stores. For more we go to ABC News Senior Technology Correspondent Martin Rath. The song continues...

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: And meanwhile Apple is continuing to lose market share with no new innovations in the pipeline except the Newton, which is a pet project of CEO John Sculley. CNBC — PANEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for the black cube. NexT just sold its factory to Canon and laid off half its employees.

dialogues.speaker: DAN RATHER
dialogues.text: The former tech giant, Apple, and for more on that--

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: With an operating system that can’t compete with Windows and no new innovations in the pipeline except Newton, a product no one seems excited about except John Sculley-- 125. 76 77 78 79 80  81 82 83 84 85 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15

dialogues.speaker: MONEY MATTERS
dialogues.text: Apple stock’s fallen from $70 a share when Steve Jobs was the heartbeat of the company to $14 today and no one thinks the Newton is gonna turn it around. The song continues..

dialogues.speaker: ABC NEWS
dialogues.text: Gil Amelio, formerly of National Semiconductor was installed as the new CEO of Apple today and he’s inherited a sinking ship. CNBC — PANEL Gil Amelio’s gonna discover that Copland’s a bust. When that happens he’ll have to mollify Wall Street and publicly promise to find an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: alternative.

dialogues.speaker: MONEY MATTERS
dialogues.text: Under the direction of Steve Jobs, NeXT’s chief software designer, Avie Tevanian, has developed an object-oriented, UNIX-like operating system that’s caught the attention of big players in Silicon Valley-- CNBC — PANEL Is the prodigal son returning? Bet on it.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: He’s coming back.

dialogues.speaker: DAN RATHER
dialogues.text: With a buzz reserved for rock stars, Steve Jobs--

dialogues.speaker: PETER JENNINGS
dialogues.text: Steve Jobs--

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Buy Apple stock. Buy it now. Sell the kids, buy the stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve Jobs is returning to Apple.

dialogues.speaker: DAN RATHER
dialogues.text: Take the “interim” off his title, Steve Jobs is now the CEO of the company he founded in his garage and fans of Apple are counting the days until his first new product. “For Unto Us a Child is Born” continues as we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant crowd waits outside to be let in. The place is festooned with banners with the now-famous “Think Differe campaign.  93 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 128.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the audience we see some familiar faces among the doze of APPLE STAFFERS working the rehearsal. JOANNA, WOZ, AND HERTZFELD and the reporter JOEL PFORZHEIMER is there too. Everyone is 10 years older than the last time we saw them

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This thing has 100MB Ethernet as standard, and why? Because we’re seeing these high speed networks in homes now. Ten percent of the homes in Silicon Valley now have Class Five wiring in them.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: 1998 Davies Symphony Hall STEVE’s on stage in front of a giant screen showing chang slides that reflect whatever he’s mentioning at the momen He’s dressed in dark jeans, a white shirt buttoned up to neck and a black sport jacket. On a small table, which is the dark at the moment, sits a computer under a dark silk sheet. STEVE’s loose and having a good time with the hundred or employees in the audience who are revved up for the big morning.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A fast modem and also a 4MB IrDA built in. You wanna beam your digital photographs from your digital camera? It’s built in to every product. (to his employees) Check it out--no notes, no note cards--ready? (back to it and faster now to play with the employees in the house) We're going to the new generation of IO--12Mb USB, two ports--we’re leaving the old Apple IO behind. Stereo Surround Sound built in to every product, a great keyboard and the coolest mouse you’ve ever seen. This time we used real mice.  93 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 129.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: (calling to the stage) We’re opening the house in 10 minutes, Steven, you want to stop horsing around?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Bless my eyes, that’s Steve Wozniak sitting out there. The APPLE employees give him a cheer and WOZ gives a shee wave.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give yourselves a treat and ask Woz if he happens to have the correct time.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I have the correct time and we’re running out of it. “A great keyboard.”

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: A great keyboard and the coolest mouse you’ve ever seen. This is what those things look like today. On the screen flashes a picture of a bulky PC. Some peopl the rehearsal audience who are seeing the full production the first time laugh.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And now I’d like to show you what they’re going to look like tomorrow. This is the iMac. STEVE yanks the dark silk sheet off an iMac as a pool of perfect light comes up on the table. CHEERS and APPLAUSE from the APPLE EMPLOYEES. STEVE clicks the mouse and the screen shows a lightning f succession of applications complete with a heart-racing percussion score-- --after which the screen fills with the words “Hello (again).” The hundred or so people sitting and standing around out the house CLAP AND CHEER.  93 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 130. 93

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pause) That was cool. Why did I like that better than I usually do?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Something was different. ANDREA CUNNINGHAM, the publicist from the Mac launch, is standing at the foot of the stage--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Hey stupid. STEVE looks at her--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) I think she’s talking to one of you guys.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Did you notice a difference?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: That’s what I’m--the exit signs were off!

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Full blackout.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You did it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: We wired all the exit lights to our board, they go out for seven seconds with the cue and come back on again in theory.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We think that’s legal?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: No, we're very certain it’s not. You want to see some quotes?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Let’s hold off on those.  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 131.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: He'll like ‘em. JOANNA shakes her head “no.”

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to STEVE) I'll give ‘em to you later.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I‘1ll take ‘em now. STEVE takes a couple of stapled pieces of paper from ANDR and as ANDREA turns around she mouths “I’m sorry” to JOAN while JOANNA says--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Pick it up from there please, we only have a couple of minutes so let's just do the 360.

dialogues.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
dialogues.text: It’s Cue 84, right where we are, you're bringing out the camera.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (presenting again) We’re gonna bring out a wireless camera we stole from Panasonic and show you what this looks like. A CAMERA OPERATOR with a camera on his shoulder comes out from the wings and circles the iMac, showing a 360 degree picture on the big screen as STEVE describes and points t what we’re looking at.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The whole thing is translucent, you can see into it. (calling out) How’s that for a compromise, Woz? You still can’t get into it but you can see into it. woz (calling back) Fair enough.  93 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 132. 93

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We've put stereo speakers in front, infra red right up here, CD-ROM drive right in the middle, dual stereo headphone jacks and all the connectors are inside one beautiful little door here--Ethernet, USB. The Apple employees CHEER. Obviously they’re not seeing t computer for the first time but it’s a proud and exciting day.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Even though this is a full-blooded Macintosh, we’re targeting it for the number one use that consumers tell us they want a computer for, which is--

dialogues.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
dialogues.text: Let’s hold please.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The answer was “The Internet.” (motioning her over) Joanna? JOANNA comes down to meet him at the edge of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Just stand in front of me. I want to look at these quotes but I don’t want Joel to know.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: They’re all great.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (reading) “A piece of hardware that blends sci-fi shimmer with the kitsch whimsy of a cocktail umbrella,” says Steven Levy in Newsweek. “It is not only the coolest looking computer introduced in years, but a chest-thumping statement that Silicon Valley’s original dream company is no longer somnambulant.”  STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 133.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: STEVE takes a moment for himself...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pause--then to JOANNA) It’s a word, it means sleepwalking.

dialogues.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
dialogues.text: Steve, I’m sorry, we have to clear the house if we’re gonna start on time.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE JOANNA
dialogues.text: We’re gonna start on time. We're starting on time.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (handing JOANNA the quotes) Take this. (calling out) Everybody, that’s it. They’ve got to mop the stage, reset and open the house. I love you guys. Everyone CHEERS-—

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Andy, come on back a minute?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hertzfeld. (to JOANNA) Walk with me. JOANNA walks up the step unit to the stage just as the st unit is being taken away. STEVE takes the paper from her they head--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Alright. JOANNA hands back the quotes--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forbes calls it “...an industry- altering success.”  94 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 134. 94

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: (pointing) Look here.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Why haven't we ever slept together?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: We’re not in love. Look here.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause--STEVE’s surprised but keeps even) Sculley.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Nobody's heard from him in five years but he did this.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Sculley talked to Forbes...

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Look what he said.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: “He has implemented the same simple strategy that made Apple so successful 15 years ago: make hit products and promote them with terrific marketing.” (pause--nods ) That was nice of him.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: It was.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I meant it.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Sightings of J.D. Salinger are more common than John Sculley.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I wasn’t being sarcastic, it was nice of him.  94 95 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 135.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pause) Do you ever talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You haven't talked to him since “88?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I'd have told you if I did.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) It doesn’t matter, I don’t want people thinking that they can cross me and then boom 15 years later I’m okay with it. (beat) I was kidding, what's wrong with you this morning?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Let’s get off the stage. STEVE and JOANNA open the heavy door that leads out into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --where they start heading down toward Steve’s dressing r We can HEAR the crowd in the lobby around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: You see how this door looks like this door? If you go through this door you're backstage, if you go through this door you're ina parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (looking at the pages of quotes) Oh man, look at this.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I just said?  95 96 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 136. 95

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I’m not worried I’m gonna accidentally walk into a parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: “The only thing Apple’s providing now is leadership in colors.”

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What does Bill Gates have against me?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I don’t know, you’re both out of your minds. Listen to me--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He dropped out of a better school than I dropped out of-- They walk into-- INT. STEVE’S DRESSING ROOM - CONTINUOUS 96

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: --but he is a tool bag and I’11l tell you why.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Make everything alright with Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You know--Joanna--boundaries.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: You’ve come to my apartment at 1AM and cleaned it so tell me where the boundary is.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: There, let's say it’s there.  96 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 137. 96

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: If I give you some real projections will you promise not to repeat them from the stage?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What do you mean real projections, what have you been giving me?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Conservative projections.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Marketing’s been lying to me?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: We've been managing expectations so that you don’t not.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What are the real projections?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: We're going to sell a million units in the first 90 days, 20,000 a month after that. STEVE looks at her for a moment and then smiles...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) Ho-ly--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: See? You wait long enough and--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: What’s more, 32% of the sales are going to go to people buying a computer for the first time and 12% are going to people using some kind of Windows machine--that's what Bill Gates has against you--and it’ll be the fastest selling computer in history. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15 138.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You brought the company back from life support after going through the misery of laying off 3,000 people and cutting 70% of the product line so Steven...it’s over...you’re going to win. It would be criminal not to enjoy this moment.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I’m enjoying it.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Make things alright with Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You know--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: --I don’t like having less privacy than other people have.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Does being a multi-billionaire take some of the sting off that?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: All Lisa (did)--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (over) All Lisa did was give her blessing. Chrisann sold the house and--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: And Lisa could have done what? File a complaint with the Department of Housing and Urban Development? How’s Lisa supposed to stop her mother from selling her own house?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: That I bought for the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: How’s she (supposed to stop her--)  96 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 139. 96

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (over) Voicing an objection would have been a step in the right direction.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: You don’t think you’re having a bizarre overreaction to a 19-year old girl allowing her mother to list her own house?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: She could have tried.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: You're saying this is really because--how’s she supposed to stop her mother--that particular mother-- from (living wherever--)

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (over) She gave Chrisann her blessing to sell the house and she did it to spite me.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I don’t care if she put a pipe bomb in the water heater, you’re gonna fix it now.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: She's been acting weird for months. She’s turned on me. And JOANNA shoves STEVE--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Fix it.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What the--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Fix it, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Fix it or I quit, how ‘bout that? I quit and you never see me again, how ‘bout that?  96 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 140. 96

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: This is me, tell me what's wrong with you this morning.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: What's been wrong with me for 19 years?! I’ve been a witness and I tell you I’ve been complicit. I love you, Steven, you know how much. I love that you don’t care how much money a person makes, you care what they make. But what you make isn’t supposed to be the best part of you. When you’re a father, that's what’s supposed to be the best part of you and it’s caused me two decades of agony, Steve, that it is, for you, the worst. It isa little thing, a very small thing, it’s not a big deal, fix it, fix it now or you can contact me at my new job working anywhere I want.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) I don’t happen to think it is a little deal. She knew--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I bought the house for--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What do you mean “no.”

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I mean “no,” the house has nothing to do with why you’re angry at Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I assure you, the house has everything to do with (why I’m--)

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: (over) Have you ever heard the phrase “Reality distortion field”?  96 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 141. 96

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Comes home from school, puts her bags down, goes straight to her friends’.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Have you?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: As it applies to you? As in “Steve's reality distortion field”?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You're getting a little prosecutorial and you're crossing some lines.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I’ll cross whatever I please. You've heard it?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I’ve heard it, I’ve read it, it’s been sung to me by Joan Baez. What you call a reality distortion field-- and I’m pretty sure you’re the one who coined the phrase--is the reason we're here.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: If I traded in my bank account for a dollar on every time someone told me something was impossible I'd come out ahead.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I know that too.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: My problem? It sure isn’t the house.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Jo-—  96 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 142. 96

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: It’s that you told her you weren’t going to pay for Harvard. That child--that earnest, unironic kid--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: She told you I wasn’t paying her tuition?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I should have hit you with something heavy a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Lisa told you I wasn’t paying her tuition?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Andy told me that.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Hertzfeld.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (pause) How would Hertzfeld know?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: He wrote Harvard a check for twenty- five thousand to cover the semester. Isn’t that why--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Are you fucking-- (pause) He paid her tuition?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Isn't that why you just asked to see him?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No I asked to see him about--this is un--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Did you tell her you weren't paying for college?  96 STEVE JOBS - Shooting Script 03/19/15

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yes, because--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: How could you (do that?)

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (over) --because her mother, who was also her landlord--Hertzfeld--I was ranting! I was, you know, I was just talking! You think I would--I was pissed off because Lisa was trying to piss me off, Joanna! That was her intent! I don’t know how I ended up the bad--

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: You obviously scared the (hell out of her).

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Hertzfeld wrote a check to Har--to pay for--is she here yet?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I’m sure she is. STEVE’s gotten himself together.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Can you have someone bring her back?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you. (beat) You know, my grandmother used to--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit, Yentl!

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I‘'ll have someone get Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Thank you. And if you see Hertzfeld-- There’s a KNOCK at the door-- 143. 96  96 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 144. 96

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quietly) Speak of the devil’s chief engineer.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s Andy.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (to JOANNA) Go. (calling) Come on in. ANDY comes in as JOANNA’s leaving--

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (to JOANNA) You look great today.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (to STEVE) Doesn't she?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: She looks fantastic, always does. (to JOANNA) Get out. JOANNA exits and closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I think I know why I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Do ya?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Steve--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Did you send the check yet?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: So Harvard got a tuition check from Andy Hertzfeld to pay for Lisa?  96 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 145. 96

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I don’t think they look that carefully, I don’t think they'd notice the check didn’t come from you.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Close one. This was almost embarrassing for me.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I understand how--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I‘1l wire you the money today.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I understand how you feel and I do apologize, I do, but let me tell you my thinking.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I can’t even think of an appropriate analogy to describe (what you did).

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I knew you guys would fix things, you always do, but in the meantime if the money wasn’t there she'd miss a semester of school.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: And she'd have to tell her friends why. And she needed things, she needed socks.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It’s cold in Cambridge, she needed warm socks.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You gave her socks.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Well I gave her money for socks.  96 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 146. 96

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You don’t get to deputize yourself as her interim-- (beat) --you don’t get to override my decisions. Do you understand? You don’t get to act like you’re her father.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Somebody had to.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: The fuck did you just say to me?!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I’ve known her since she was six. I also consider--Chrisann’s a friend outside of what you and I--outside of our (relationship).

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: So you're like a family advisor.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I'm a family friend.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Then you probably know Lisa’s been seeing a therapist.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: For many years.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Without my knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: That really wasn’t my business.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I'm fascinated by what you think is and isn’t your business.  96 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 147. 96

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Lisa’s been going to a therapist and she likes it and would love for you and Chrisann to go with her.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: And the reason you know that is that you’re the one who recommended the therapist.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I know a guy, he specializes in--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: No, I mean, you’re the one who recommended that she see a therapist.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I--you know what, it was a while ago and I don’t remember how the whole--who said what to--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You told Chrisann that Lisa should see a therapist.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Steve, you’re stigmatizing--it’s not--my thing was how can it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Let’s find out.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Chrisann is my friend.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What was the reason you gave?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (pause) You mean--

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: What was the reason you gave Chrisann why Lisa should see a therapist?  96 STEVE JOBS -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shooting Script 03/19/15 148. 96

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
